transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi Zhi—this is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Did I catch you at a good time, or is now a bad moment?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, yeah, I have a couple minutes. What's this about?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great, thanks. I noticed Acme Corp. recently started a migration initiative and saw you're mostly on Firebase today. I wanted to see if you've looked at MongoDB Atlas as part of that process?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, we're aware of it. Firebase's been working well for us, though; we're just consolidating right now.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, makes sense. Just out of curiosity, is there anything in your current stack—maybe with scalability or data security—that you'd want to improve as you consolidate?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, security and compliance are non-negotiable, and Firebase hasn’t given us any issues on that front. Performance is solid under our peak loads, too.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely, I get it. Atlas is fully compliant—SOC2, HIPAA, PCI—the works. And we have retailers handling thousands of transactions per second during peak events. Any interest in a pilot to see how it compares?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Not really. To be completely transparent, our team doesn't want to risk another migration right now. We're just getting stable with what we have.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Understood. If cost is a concern, I should mention Atlas can actually help optimize spend as your needs grow. Has that come up in conversations internally?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, price is always a factor, but it's not just about the dollars. It's the migration risk and potential for vendor lock-in. We want to avoid more complexity, if anything.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely—makes sense. Out of curiosity, is MongoDB on the roadmap at all for the future, or is it off the table for now?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, not in the next year, no. We’re pretty set with Firebase and don’t want to reevaluate again anytime soon.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Got it. I appreciate your candor, Zhi. Mind if I check in next year, just in case priorities shift?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, that's fine. But honestly, I wouldn't expect any change.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally fair. Thanks for your time today, Zhi. If anything comes up, you know where to find me.
